data.job_description:
This career developer is responsible for the lifecycle of critical corporate-wide and customer-specific technology based products. The specialist further works with primarily third-party systems and develops necessary custom entities, ensuring components meet business requirements. At this career level, the incumbent generally works on teams that provide design, development, and services for enterprise and heavily integrated applications. He or she may coach and oversee the work of other specialists.

What will you do?
• Provides application software development services and technical support for existing architecture or new deployments. Gathers requirements and develops specifications to integrate into applications. Adheres to approved standards and assists in developing new standards in software development.
• Develops program logic for new applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications. Considers and/or provides multiple options or solutions to satisfy organizational needs.
• Codes, tests, including writing test plans, debugs, documents, implements and maintains software applications. Enhances appropriate levels of functionality through code customization and application configuration.
• Develops strategies around existing technology products to ensure these products produce expected results and benefit to customers. Ensures that improvements are successfully implemented and impacts across the value stream and application are considered.
• Provides complex technical services throughout the lifecycle of customer-specific technology based products. Primarily works with Cloud or Purchased applications.
• Collaborates on cross-functional project teams as a key resource on data processes, data governance, and application systems.
• May coach and provide expertise to other professionals and support staff in the applications development discipline.

Why work here?
• The mission: Join a team that is motivated to release children from poverty in Jesus’ name.
• Our benefits: Receive generous paid time off, 10% contribution to a 403(b) retirement fund on top of your salary, excellent healthcare coverage, free short-term professional counseling, and more.
• Spiritual growth: Participate in regular chapel services, prayer groups, and department devotionals.

data.job_description:
The Senior React Native Developer role is an opportunity for a team-based individual that excels in defining, developing, and maintaining a full IoT platform. This person will be critical in helping Marvin deliver on its promise to bring happy healthy living to its customers. You will have primary responsibility to deliver the specified product/solution to market and will primarily be focused on development, however, will also be a primary doer for Marvin’s Connected Home team and work across all including the core window and door products, electrical, mechanical, and firmware.

As a React Native App Developer (iOS and Android) at Marvin, you’ll be at the forefront of the tech industry, building an innovative Internet of Things (IoT) system that improves the way people live at home and positive impact their health and well-being. You’ll have the opportunity to apply your skills and experience right away, working with a highly-motivated team of UX & UI Designers and Product Engineers.

Additionally, you will help lead the efforts of building Marvin’s digital development understanding and expertise within the IoT space. A technical champion internally on not only understanding but crafting the strategy on how we develop digital product solutions. This role will play a heavy role in crafting and driving the quality processes as intended not only as a standalone system, but within other ecosystems.

Highlights of your role
• Working as a part of an agile development team building out our IoT Platform, you will collaborate with a focused team of developers, architects, UX, UI designers, and product managers in building the app.
• Analyze and define software requirements.
• Evolve Marvin’s IoT Platform based on the latest mobile technologies (Full-Stack)
• Support debugging or solving efforts internally.

You're a good fit if you have
• Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or Engineering
• At least 6-10 years of professional experience in full-stack application development projects.
• 3+ years of hands-on experience developing frontends in React Native
• 1-2 years of experience working in an Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud environment
• Experience with standard deployment technologies.
• RESTful APIs, Microservices, webservices, expert in SOA design and technical implementations
• Experience with Voice Assistants (Alexa, Google Home, etc) and smarthome protocals (zigbee, matter, z-wave) a plus.
• Experience with app store deployments and management
• Design, develop, test, deploy, support and evolve software (native / hybrid applications, API’s)
• Lead individual priorities, deadlines and deliverables
• Participate in QA & UAT on continuous integration and delivery as well as automated and manual testing to ensure good quality solutions.
• Participate in an agile delivery process

Nice To Have
• Experience within IoT or smart/connected home solutions
• Microsoft Azure IoT Services experience
• Big Data and Data Warehouse experience or interfacing with Data Management teams.
• Success working with hardware and firmware teams to plan, develop, refine, and launch successful products
• Comfortable understanding of electro-mechanical products
• Familiarity with Confluence, JIRA, Miro, Figma
• Experience working within a greenfield software development environment

Hybrid Role

This role has been designed to be hybrid. The team gets together twice per week to collaborate and connect with other teams.

Your opportunity for better living

At Marvin, we’re driven to imagine and create better ways of living. And that goes beyond our customers, to our communities and the colleagues beside us every day. We offer competitive compensation, an extensive benefits package that includes health insurance on day one of employment, paid time off and paid holidays, and a 401K retirement savings match.

We also support your overall wellness in other meaningful ways, including your own company-funded well-being account that can be used for anything from travel to a day at the spa, gym memberships or fun experiences with family and friends. You will be rewarded through our profit-sharing program, which recognizes the important role all employees play in making Marvin a success year, after year.

As a premier company with locations across North America, Marvin’s portfolio also includes three additional premium brands: Infinity Replacement Windows, TruStile Doors, and Marvin Coastline. Together, we share one purpose and live our values. Our culture is built on generations of doing the right thing and putting our people first. Join us, and experience better living at Marvin.

EOE

This job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of the activities, duties, or responsibilities of the employee. Accommodations may be made to enable an individual with a disability to perform the essential functions of the position. Any offer of employment is contingent on the completion of a background check and drug screen to company standards.

Position Description

As a React Native Software Engineer will design, develop and integrate solutions to solve business and technical requirements across iOS and Android mobile applications. The ideal candidate must be passionate about technology, writing code and solve problems, be a self-motivated quick learner who enjoys learning and sharing knowledge.

This role can be located in Lafayette, LA or Bloomfield, CT.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Develop, implement and maintain high quality mobile software for applications that combine native and hybrid components.

Extend and develop frameworks that are reusable and scalable.

Write clean, secure, efficient and modular code.

Simplify and improve existing application code ensuring high unit test coverage.

Identify potential problems and resolve application bottlenecks.

Collaborate with the team members, product owners, user experience team and other engineers to define, design and publish new features.

Maintain cutting edge knowledge of current and emerging technologies, industry trends and standards.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

6+ Years of experience with React-Native, Redux, Redux-Saga, TypeScript.

Extensive experience with JavaScript Frameworks and experience building applications for mobile platform.

Familiarity with RESTful APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) to connect applications to back-end services.

Experience with few of the following technologies: React, Angular, Kotlin, Swift, Spring Boot, NodeJS.

Experience with continuous integration / Continuous deployment.

Experience with AWS cloud.

Desired Experience / Qualifications:

Experience working in a mobile application which contains mixture of native (Kotlin, swift) and web technologies (WebView, React-Native, Native-Script. etc.).

Knowledge of Apple's and Google's design principles and application interface guidelines.

Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning.

Bachelor's degree in computer science or software engineering/equivalent work experience.

Company Description

ClientSolv Technologies is an IT solution firm with over a decade of experience serving Fortune 1000 companies, public sector and small to medium sized companies. ClientSolv Technologies is a woman-owned and operated company that is certified as a WMBE, 8a firm by the Federal government's Small Business Administration.

Job Description

Job Location: Englewood, CO or Jacksonville,FL

Duration : 3+ months contract with to hire (will definitely convert to fulltime after contract )

We are in search of a Front end JavaScript software engineer with expertise as a React and React Native development to work in the application development team within our enterprise Applications platforms.

In this role, you will work with the engineering team to specify, design, develop, code, test and implement solutions to support this framework. You will participate in standards for development and software selection, and make application processing and design recommendations. You will also collaborate closely with the Backend Engineers to ensure the team has the support needed to build the user-facing platform. As a Senior team member, you will also mentor junior engineers, help establish strong coding standards, recommend libraries, code enhancements and optimizations and participate in code reviews.

Who are we?

Auction Technology Group is a global technology company with over 350 employees, headquartered in London, United Kingdom with global offices in Omaha, Nebraska, Lehi, Utah, New York, New York and Hamburg, Germany. ATG's platform powers over 70,000 live and timed auctions every year across multiple verticals including Art and Antiques, Classic Cars, Heavy Construction, Agricultural, Industrial & Commercial, and Consumer Retail Returns and many more.

A demanding but highly rewarding culture, people at ATG have the ability to future-proof their careers and widen their skillset since we look for multi-faceted individuals. Exposure to tech development, digital marketing, product management, account management, brand awareness and much more is assured early on in your career at ATG even if your specific role is in a different area of the business. Successful people at ATG relish the opportunity to upskill themselves and gain experience in a variety of disciplines.

About the opportunity:

LiveAuctioneers (an affiliate of ATG) is hiring a (US full-time remote) Senior Software Engineer, Front End Mobile Applications. Our inclusive teams use a friendly and collaborative small-team approach (5-6 engineers per team) to help us build the trusted marketplace of collectibles curated by experts. We operate and build on a service-oriented, event-driven architecture, utilizing continuous integration and continuous delivery.
